definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Have you set up value-add packages?
sentences.chinese: 你是否設立了增值包價？

sentences.english: Three company are fighting for first place.
sentences.chinese: 公司中包價旅遊市場中競爭當第一。

sentences.english: There is a three-day package tour.
sentences.chinese: 有一個三天的包價旅遊。

sentences.english: A disadvantage is that they may have somewhat of a packaged-tour or production line feel.
sentences.chinese: 缺點是給遊客一種包價旅遊或流水線的感覺。

sentences.english: Yes. We want to go package tour. Do you offer this service?
sentences.chinese: 有。我們想辦理包價旅遊。你們提供這種服務嗎？

sentences.english: This tour company has discount price on package holidays.
sentences.chinese: 這家旅遊公司對包價旅行團有一定的折扣。

sentences.english: As i know , no airlines offer the package tour now.
sentences.chinese: 據我所知，現在沒有哪家航空公司提供包價旅遊。

sentences.english: They have beat their rival into second place in the package holiday market.
sentences.chinese: 他們在包價度假旅遊市場的激烈角逐中擊敗了對手。

sentences.english: We have a full package tour.
We sell mainly package tour press at under 200.
sentences.chinese: 我們組織的包價旅行團的價格在200英鎊以內。

definition: variant of 訂單|订单[ding4 dan1]
token (used instead of money for slot machines, in game arcades etc)
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
(computing) transcoding/to convert (from one encoding to another)
see 無記名|无记名[wu2 ji4 ming2]
to claim a credit against/tax reduction

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Nong2 ye4 Yin2 hang2
